name: cifti-rois-from-extrema
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Create cifti roi maps from extrema maps.

For each nonzero value in each map, make a map with an ROI around that location.  If the -gaussian option is specified, then normalized gaussian kernels are output instead of ROIs.  The <method> argument to -overlap-logic must be one of ALLOW, CLOSEST, or EXCLUDE.  ALLOW is the default, and means that ROIs are treated independently and may overlap.  CLOSEST means that ROIs may not overlap, and that no ROI contains vertices that are closer to a different seed vertex.  EXCLUDE means that ROIs may not overlap, and that any vertex within range of more than one ROI does not belong to any ROI.

inputs.name: surf_limit
inputs.description: geodesic distance limit from vertex, in mm

inputs.name: vol_limit
inputs.description: euclidean distance limit from voxel center, in mm

inputs.name: direction
inputs.description: which dimension an extrema map is along, ROW or COLUMN

inputs.name: opt_left_surface_surface
inputs.description: specify the left surface to use: the left surface file

inputs.name: opt_right_surface_surface
inputs.description: specify the right surface to use: the right surface file

inputs.name: opt_cerebellum_surface_surface
inputs.description: specify the cerebellum surface to use: the cerebellum surface file

inputs.name: gaussian
inputs.description: generate gaussian kernels instead of flat ROIs

type.name: gaussian
type.description: generate gaussian kernels instead of flat ROIs

inputs.name: surf_sigma
inputs.description: the sigma for the surface gaussian kernel, in mm

inputs.name: vol_sigma
inputs.description: the sigma for the volume gaussian kernel, in mm

inputs.name: opt_overlap_logic_method
inputs.description: how to handle overlapping ROIs, default ALLOW: the method of resolving overlaps

inputs.name: opt_merged_volume
inputs.description: treat volume components as if they were a single component
